openalexPro 0.1.0

openalexR::oa_request() with additional argument

Source: R/pro_request.R
pro_request.Rd

This function adds one argument to openalexR::oa_request(), namely output. When specified, all return values from OpenAlex will be saved as jaon files in that directory and the return value is the directory of the json files.

Usage

pro_request(
  query_url,
  pages = 1000,
  output = NULL,
  overwrite = FALSE,
  mailto = oap_mail(),
  api_key = oap_apikey,
  workers = 1,
  verbose = FALSE,
  progress = TRUE
)

Arguments

query_url

The URL of the API query or a list of URLs returned from pro_query().

pages

The number of pages to be downloaded. The default is set to 1000, which would be 2,000,000 works. It is recommended to not increase it beyond 1000 due to server load and to use the snapshot instead. If NULL, all pages will be downloaded. Default: 1000.

output

directory where the JSON files are saved. Default is a temporary directory. If NULL, the return value from call to openalexR::oa_request() with all the arguments is returned

overwrite

Logical. If TRUE, output will be deleted if it already exists.

mailto

The email address of the user. See oap_mail().

api_key

The API key of the user. See oap_apikey.

workers

Number of parallel workers to use if query_url is a list. Defaults to 1.

verbose

Logical indicating whether to show verbose messages.

progress

Logical default TRUE indicating whether to show a progress bar.

Value

If output is NULL, the return value from call to openalexR::oa_request(), otherwise the complete path to the expanded and normalized output.

Details

For the documentation please see openalexR::oa_request() If query_url is a list, the function is called for each element of the list in parallel using a maximum of workers parallel R sessions. The results from the individual URLs in the list are returned in a folder named after the names of the list elements in the output folder.
